quote: Do you need me, Julian?

quote: How did you know it was me?
scene: 1    INT. HOLOSUITE - GRID WALLS - DAY - CLOSE ON A HUGE

quote: There are different ways to recognize    someone... the rhythm of their steps,    for example.
scene: 1    INT. HOLOSUITE - GRID WALLS - DAY - CLOSE ON A HUGE

quote: You're... remarkable.
scene: 1    INT. HOLOSUITE - GRID WALLS - DAY - CLOSE ON A HUGE

quote: Julian, you and I have to have a    talk about Trills and relationships...
scene: 1    INT. HOLOSUITE - GRID WALLS - DAY - CLOSE ON A HUGE

quote: Fine... we'll do it over supper...   Quark has found me a delightfully    dry champagne, estate bottled on    Korris One...
scene: 1    INT. HOLOSUITE - GRID WALLS - DAY - CLOSE ON A HUGE

quote: Julian...
scene: 1    INT. HOLOSUITE - GRID WALLS - DAY - CLOSE ON A HUGE

quote: (without pause,     examining the sphere)   What is this?
scene: 1    INT. HOLOSUITE - GRID WALLS - DAY - CLOSE ON A HUGE

quote: An Altonian brain teaser.
scene: 1    INT. HOLOSUITE - GRID WALLS - DAY - CLOSE ON A HUGE

quote: Brain teaser?
scene: 1    INT. HOLOSUITE - GRID WALLS - DAY - CLOSE ON A HUGE

quote: A puzzle.
scene: 1    INT. HOLOSUITE - GRID WALLS - DAY - CLOSE ON A HUGE

quote: Really.  I love puzzles.  How does    it work?
scene: 1    INT. HOLOSUITE - GRID WALLS - DAY - CLOSE ON A HUGE

quote: It responds to neural theta waves.   The goal is to turn the sphere    into a solid color...
scene: 1    INT. HOLOSUITE - GRID WALLS - DAY - CLOSE ON A HUGE

quote: That's all... ?
scene: 1    INT. HOLOSUITE - GRID WALLS - DAY - CLOSE ON A HUGE

quote: That's all.  I've been trying to    master it on and off for, oh... a    hundred and forty years...       Care to try?
scene: 1    INT. HOLOSUITE - GRID WALLS - DAY - CLOSE ON A HUGE

quote: Just sit comfortably... release your    tension into my hands...
scene: 1    INT. HOLOSUITE - GRID WALLS - DAY - CLOSE ON A HUGE

quote: Your hands are cold...
scene: 1    INT. HOLOSUITE - GRID WALLS - DAY - CLOSE ON A HUGE

quote: That is a peculiarity of the Trill...
scene: 1    INT. HOLOSUITE - GRID WALLS - DAY - CLOSE ON A HUGE

quote: Cold hands, warm heart...
scene: 1    INT. HOLOSUITE - GRID WALLS - DAY - CLOSE ON A HUGE

quote: Concentrate on the sphere,    Julian. Clear your mind.  This    requires focus and clarity of    thought.
scene: 1    INT. HOLOSUITE - GRID WALLS - DAY - CLOSE ON A HUGE

quote: I understand completely.       What is that exotic scent you're    wearing?
scene: 1    INT. HOLOSUITE - GRID WALLS - DAY - CLOSE ON A HUGE

quote: Focus and clarity of thought.
scene: 1    INT. HOLOSUITE - GRID WALLS - DAY - CLOSE ON A HUGE

quote: Yes, yes... I have it...
scene: 1    INT. HOLOSUITE - GRID WALLS - DAY - CLOSE ON A HUGE

quote: I'm going to release it to you now...    Okay?
scene: 1    INT. HOLOSUITE - GRID WALLS - DAY - CLOSE ON A HUGE

quote: Okay.

scene: 1    INT. HOLOSUITE - GRID WALLS - DAY - CLOSE ON A HUGE

quote: Business is good, Quark.  You're    almost making an honest living.
A lot of new faces.
The wormhole does bring them our    way, doesn't it...
Everybody wants a piece of the new    frontier...
And I'm sure you've already tried to    sell it to a few of them...
Grapevine says Chief O'Brien and the    Missus are having problems...
(a beat, nods, studying     them)   I'll never understand the humanoid    need to...       ...couple...
You've never... coupled?

Choose not to.  Too many compromises.    (off Quark's curious     reaction)   You want to watch a Karo-Net    tournament, she wants to listen to    music.  So you compromise.   You listen to music.  You like    Earth Jazz, she prefers Klingon    opera... so you compromise.  You    listen to Klingon opera.  So here    you were ready to have a nice    evening watching the Karo-Net    match and you wind up spending    an agonizing night listening to    Klingon opera...    (a beat, watching the     O'Briens)   What could they be going on about    like that anyway?
She doesn't like it here.
Who does?
Don't even think about it.
I can so think about it.
You might as well try to find a drink    of water on the Yadozi desert...       ... besides I'd say our new Commander    is interested in her...
Not at all... I know for a fact,    when she was a he... you know, before    she got this new body, they were old    friends.
Things change.
How long's he been here?
Came in on a transport last night.
Just steamed Azna, please...
Well some things are still the same...
If you'd listen to me, you'd be eating    steamed Azna too...
Dax, did I ever tell you about the    meals my father used to cook for us    when we were kids...
All the time...

(ignoring it, wanting     to tell it again     anyway)   Every night at my house, my dad    insisted that we have supper together    as a family.  He would try out his    new recipes on us... he used to    call us his "test tasters."
Steamed Azna will put years on your    life.
I don't want years on my life.   Not if I can only eat steamed    Azna... sauteed... rolloped...    fricasseed -- fine.  But not    steamed...
I've missed your steamed Azna.
You must miss Curzon too...
He was... you were... are... a    mentor... another father to me...
This happens a lot to Trills,    Benjamin. Sometimes, our friendships    with other species don't survive    because of the changes...
It won't be like that with us.   It's just... a little uncomfortable    right now...
I suggest you allow yourself to    be comfortable with your    discomfort.  Time can do the    rest...
Keiko...
Dabo!
I don't want you on this station.
That's too bad.  I have every    right to be here.
I decide who has rights and who    doesn't on this Promenade.
Better ask your Federation superiors    about that.
I don't have to ask anyone.
You have twenty-six hours to get off    this station.
Look, I'm willing to ask for a    transfer if that'll make you happy...
That's not fair either... you'd have    to give up your promotion...
Not necessarily...
I wish I knew the right thing to do,    Miles... I'm just lost here...    (repeating something     she's said a dozen     times already)   Starfleet doesn't need a botanist on    this station...
Keiko, there's a whole new quadrant    on the other side of the wormhole...    full of new plant life to explore...
And ships going to explore it...    and I'm not on any of them...
We'll be sending runabouts through    the wormhole... I'll see to it that    you get to go...
I don't need favors from you.       I just need to be useful.

Just think how much more attractive    this place could be if you planted    some trees and flowers along the    Promenade... or you might even create    an arboretum from the new specimens    we bring back from the Gamma    Quadrant...
You really want to raise your daughter    in "this place," Miles?
Kira to O'Brien...
Go ahead.
We've got a non-functional power    transfer grid on level five... all    the upper docking pylons are out of    commission...
On my way, Major.
Hi.

quote: What do you want, Hew-man?
scene: 24   INT. PROMENADE - LOWER LEVEL - ON JAKE

quote: My name is Jake.
scene: 24   INT. PROMENADE - LOWER LEVEL - ON JAKE

quote: I know who you are.
scene: 24   INT. PROMENADE - LOWER LEVEL - ON JAKE

quote: What's yours?
scene: 24   INT. PROMENADE - LOWER LEVEL - ON JAKE

quote: Why do you care?
scene: 24   INT. PROMENADE - LOWER LEVEL - ON JAKE

quote: Not exactly a lot of friends to choose    from here, you know what I mean?
scene: 24   INT. PROMENADE - LOWER LEVEL - ON JAKE

quote: Nog... my name's Nog.
scene: 24   INT. PROMENADE - LOWER LEVEL - ON JAKE

quote: His name is Ibudan... he used to run    black market goods through here to    the surface during the Cardassian    occupation... gouging his fellow man    who needed medical supplies and so    forth... some Bajorans actually    considered him a hero.  But I saw    him let a child die when the parents    couldn't afford the drug that would've    saved her life.
A few years back, he killed a    Cardassian officer who wanted a payoff    to look the other way.   He went to prison for murder.        I sent him there.
I sent him there.
For murder?  What's he doing out?
The provisional government let him    go.  Killing a Cardassian isn't    considered much of a crime nowadays.
Doesn't sound like there's much we    can do about it.
I can get him off my Promenade...
(laying back, not in     his face, diplomatic)   If he hasn't done anything wrong,    you can't just arbitrarily force him    to leave...
Watch me.
Mister Odo, you're not going to take    the law into your own hands...
The law?  Commander, laws change    depending on who's making them...
Cardassians one day, Federation the    next... but justice... is    justice... and as long as I'm in    charge of security...
If you can't work within the rules,    I'll find someone who can.
What are they?
Garanian Bolites.  C'mon...
Well, I guess I know the competition    now...
What are you talking about, Julian?
Did you have a nice dinner with    Commander Sisko?
(reacts, a beat, shakes     her head)   Julian...
It's time I explain that Trills don't    look for romance the way humans do.
In fact, we consider it quite a    nuisance.
A nuisance... ?

It is a weakness of the young...    and although a Trill host may have    these kinds of...       ... feelings occasionally, it is our    wish to live on a higher plane... to    try to rise above those sorts of    temptations...
(picking up on     something, with hope)   Aha...       You said "try to rise above"...   which suggests you don't always    succeed...
(I haven't gotten     anywhere with this,     have I?)   Julian...
Sisko to Doctor Bashir...
Go ahead.
We need medical assistance above the    bar in Holosuite four.
Acknowledged, Commander.       I still have that champagne on ice.
(overlapping one     another)   Help us!  Somebody help us!
scene: 31   INT. REPLIMAT (CAFE PROMENADE) - CLOSE ON JAKE

quote: The door opened only twice... first    time when the computer logged Ibudan's    check-in at seventeen hundred hours,    sixteen minutes... the suite was    secured so no one else could enter...   He ran Lauriento massage halo-   program number one-oh-one-A.   Thirteen minutes later the door opened    for the second time, but since Ibudan    obviously didn't exit... we have to    assume that's when the killer left...
Any evidence of a beam-in during    those thirteen minutes?
No...
Then how did the killer get in... ?
He might have entered the holosuite    at the same time Ibudan did...

Cause of death is no mystery.   The knife was thrust directly    between the left and right    thoracic vertebrae... perforating    the lower ventricle of the    heart.  The murderer apparently    had a decent knowledge of    Bajoran anatomy.
Doctor, I want you to look for    evidence that could establish someone    was in here with him...
I'll do a sweep for hair follicles,    any skin or cellular remnants, and    DNA fragments...
How many ships have left since    yesterday...
Two.  A Federation survey ship...   and a Vulcan science vessel...
Advise all ships in dock that    departures will be delayed until    further notice...
And they were just looking for    trouble... those kids have no reason    to be hanging around the Promenade...
It's about the only place they have    to go... you can't keep them locked    in their rooms...

It's not like a starship, Miles...    the kind of freedom that children    have on the Enterprise just won't    work on a space station... there are    too many ways to get into serious    trouble here...       What this place needs is a school.
All ships have been informed of the    delays, Commander...
Major, do you know Mister Zayra, who    operates the Transit Aid center... ?
We've met...
He was just telling me something    disturbing.  I think you should hear    it...
It's just that... the murdered man,    Ibudan... I spoke with him yesterday,    about an hour before it happened.
Where was this?
In Quark's.  By the dabo table.   It was right after his scuffle    with the shape-shifter... I can    only tell you that Ibudan was    scared... he told me he was    afraid Odo might kill him.
There isn't a more honorable man on    this station than the constable...
Maybe so... all I know is an hour    later, Ibudan was dead...
Computer: lights.
This was Ibudan's quarters... feel    free to look around...
Double accommodations?
That's what he requested... but only    one passenger was logged in... he    probably just wanted larger    quarters...
If there's anything else you need...
I want a record of all the passengers    on board...
Of course.  I'll get you a copy of    the ship's manifest.
Computer... how many entries made    from this terminal during the last    seventy-eight hours.
Seven entries noted in personal    calendar files.
Show them to me.
Take me to stardate 46384...
You won't get an argument from me,    Mrs. O'Brien... when I found out    what happened this morning on the    Promenade...
We weren't doing anything...
I don't want to talk about this now...       It's this Ferengi boy, Nog...
He's the only one here even close to    my age...

That's not exactly true, Jake.       There are twelve other children on    board... ranging from eight to    sixteen.  The problem is there's no    structured activity for them...       Jake, don't you miss the schools you    used to go to... ?
(quick, defensive,     and not true)   No.       I guess.  Studying alone with the    computer... it kinda gets boring    sometimes.
I've never actually been a teacher,    Commander... but it's something I've    always thought about doing...
Mrs. O'Brien... as a Starfleet    Commander and as a father, I think    this is a terrific idea.  What do    you need?
Some space...
We'll find it...
Computers..
You'll have them.

I hope you realize what you're getting    yourself into... I can't force the    Bajora, the Ferengi or anyone else    to send their children to your    school... and even if you do get    them to come, every one of them has    a different culture, a different    philosophy... I mean, when you think    of the values Nog's parents must    have taught him...
There's nothing wrong with Nog...
Last week I had him in jail for    stealing... this week he's my son's    best friend...
I know I'll have to come up with an    innovative program... But I can't    imagine any parent not welcoming the    news of a school opening here.  Thank    you again, Commander.
If I hear you're hanging around with    him...
I thought you didn't want to talk    about this now...
These are the DNA sequence analyses,    the cellular spectrographs, the    particulate matter tracers... I asked    Lieutenant Dax to confirm my    findings... and I'm afraid she    concurs...
There were no new DNA traces found    in the holosuite.
You're saying no one went into the    room with him?
Aside from those of us who were in    there after the body was discovered...       ... this was the only DNA    present and we've identified it as    Ibudan's.
Wait a minute.  Ibudan goes in the    holosuite alone, locks the door...    nobody transports in... a few minutes    later he's murdered... how is that    possible?
It's not.  Unless the murder was    committed by someone who could get    through the cracks in the door...    say... a shape-shifter.

It's a pretty neat package.  His    calendar shows he was planning to    meet with me at the time of the    murder.  No one except a shape-shifter    could get into the holosuite.  And    since I'd obviously be called there    after the body was discovered, traces    of my DNA wind up at the scene of    the crime.
Do you have any kind of an alibi?
Major, I have to return to my natural    state every eighteen hours to    regenerate... to be quite honest    about it, I was in a pail in the    back of my office when Ibudan was    killed.
The killer might have known your    regenerative cycle and planned the    murder accordingly.
Like I said, a neat package.
Who might want to frame you for    murder?
I can think of about five hundred    different people.  But I haven't    seen any of 'em around the station    recently.
You think that Federation doctor    could do a sweep of Ibudan's quarters    for me... see if he can find out if    somebody else was using that second    bed.
I'll get him over there right away.
Thank-you, Major.
You want my boy to go to a Federation    school?
Not just Federation.  I'm developing    a curriculum that will take a much    broader approach...
Little lady, little lady... what do    you know of Ferengi education?
I understand you employ a work-study    approach with apprenticeships in a    wide range of economic and business    fields...
We throw them into the cutthroat    competition of Ferengi commerce...    and anyone who survives, graduates.     Are you prepared to teach that to my    son?
I'm sure I couldn't improve on what    you've taught him in that    department...
Thank-you.  Thank-you.  I've taught    him everything I know. It's so    important that we prepare our youth    for the challenges of the future.

Exactly.  Consider the advantage    your son will have over other Ferengi    once he's been exposed to other    cultures... once he learns how others    run their economies, conduct business,    negotiate...
You will teach my son these things?
Knowledge is power, Mister Rom.
It can't work... he will not listen    to you...
Why not?
You are fe-male.
So?
My son cannot learn anything from a    fe-male human teacher.
Let him try it for a few weeks.   He has nothing to lose... and...    (trying the conspiracy     again)   ... so much to gain.
I don't think so.
Will you promise to think about it    at least?
Yes.  Yes.  Of course.  Now, I'm    really very busy.
Place your wagers... place your    wagers... get this lovely young woman    a drink on me...
What do we know about him anyway?   He isn't one of us.
He isn't one of anything.
You know what really bothers me... ?       ... this shifter was the last security    chief for the Cardassians here...
He's the one who caught Ibudan for    them...
What's he still doing in charge of    security...
You're right.  Somebody ought to    talk to Major Kira...
Nobody knows him like I know him.   Let me tell you something -- he's    an ill-tempered, over-bearing    crosspatch.  But he was no    Cardassian collaborator.  And he's    no killer.
I can't believe you're defending    him, Quark.  You're his worst enemy.
Guess that's the closest thing he    has in this world to a friend.
I understand your concerns...
We're not saying he's innocent or    guilty, Commander... but it just    seems reasonable under the    circumstances that he...
Thank-you for coming...
This is wrong...
What would you suggest we do?
He didn't do it.
The man we have in charge of a murder    investigation is the prime suspect,    Major.  Those people have a right to    complain...
Even if he's innocent, it's still    could be seen as a conflict of    interest, Kira.
You're going to relieve him of duty.
I don't see any other choice.
He's been completely candid about    the investigation... he could have    covered his tracks half a dozen times    already if he were guilty.
I appreciate how you feel.  But the    decision stands.  I'll inform him    myself.
The only curious thing I found were    seofurane fragments near the matter    reclamation unit... it appears he    was trying to get rid of them...
Have any idea what they're from?
I know exactly what they're from...    a biological sample container.  I    use containers like them all the    time.
What would Ibudan be doing with a    biological sample container...
That I'm not so sure about... but    when I analyzed the fragments, I    detected... traces of a complex    organic structure...
Translate, Doctor.
It suggests Ibudan may have been    conducting some sort of medical    experiment on board his ship...
He wasn't a doctor or a scientist.
Let's see what a standard    electrophoretic analysis tells us...
What the... ?       The complex proteins are breaking    down into DNA fragments...
What does that mean?
It means...
Sisko to Odo.
Here.
May I see you in my office, please.
Acknowledged.
Yes, Commander?
Sit down.
I'm temporarily relieving you of    duty.  I'm sure the reasons are    obvious.
Who will be taking over the    investigation.
I've placed Major Kira and Lieutenant    Dax in charge.
Is that all, Commander?
I want you to know... I don't    personally believe that you were    responsible for this...
Really.  Now how can that be true?

You don't know me.  You have no reason    to believe that I wouldn't    kill Ibudan if it suited my fancy.   So don't tell me there isn't some    doubt inside of you, some question    about whether or not I murdered    the man.
I simply feel that putting Kira and    Dax in charge of the investigation    will be in everyone's best interests    including your own...
I'll take care of my own best    interests.
I can find out who did it for you...
Not for me.  Tell it to Starfleet.
Well now, there's a piece of good    news to brighten my day...
Better take advantage of my absence    while you can, Quark...
Oh, I will, I will.  Count on it.
You do and I'll...
You're gonna get sloppy without me    to keep an eye on you...
I don't think so.  You've kept me on    my toes for too long now.
Sure.  I've turned you into a better    crook.
Like it or not.
You had me going...
I did, didn't I...
Yes you did...

I've been asking some friends at    Kran-Tobol prison about Ibudan...    if he made any enemies while he was    there.       Couldn't find any.  Mostly he stayed    around the Bajoran dissidents the    Cardassians locked up...
It's growing exponentially... we're    going to have to increase the    metabolic field energy...
Just what is it that's growing in    there... ?
Aren't those DNA patterns humanoid,    Julian?
That's what they look like to me...    but there's a genetic drift I can't    put my finger on...
What the hell was Ibudan up to?
I'm afraid we'll have to wait to see    what this becomes before we have a    clue...       You can transfer it to the larger    field now...
Care for some lunch?
Sure.
No thanks.  Major Kira is waiting    for my report...
Just how many different lives do you    think she's led...
I'm not even sure.  He'll...    she'll... go through a list of them...    and then another one comes out in a    later conversation...   I'd guess Jadzia is at least    the sixth host...
Has she changed much?
Changed?
From the last one, Curzon Dax...   I understand a Trill integrates    the personality of each new    host...

I guess I'll have to find that out...       If I told you about some of the    mischief he and I got into... there    was a time when I was no older than    you are... we were at the running of    the Rujian Steeplechase... Dax loves    the races... anyway, there were these    gorgeous seven foot Ruji twin sisters    that Curzon knew and he and I...
I guess we won't be doing that again    soon.  Will we.
You care a great deal for her, don't    you...
Dax and I are just friends, doctor.     If you're interested, you have nothing    to fear from me.
Are you sure?  If I were in your    shoes, knowing Dax as intimately as    you do, I think I'd find her hard to    resist...
You don't understand, Doctor.   Dax used to beat me regularly at    bare fist Juro Counterpunch.
I guess you won't be doing that again    soon either...
In a semi-circle... facing the    module... that's right...
Here's Mommy...
Mommy, where'd you go?
I'm getting ready for school tomorrow,    honey...
Can I come to school?
I wish you could... at least I'd    know one student would be coming...    but you have to wait a year or two...
How's it going?
We'll be ready in time.  In time for    what, I'm not sure.  Aside from    Commander Sisko, I haven't had a    firm commitment from any of the    parents I've spoken to.       What's this?
Oh, just something I replicated on    the way over.
Help Mommy with her present, Molly...
Miles...
I want to see you standing in the    Promenade tomorrow morning ringing    your school bell...
Thank-you.
You'd better take her home...
O'Brien to Ops... security to the    Promenade on the double...
Acknowledged.
O'Brien to Sisko...
I'm here, Chief... what's going on...
We have a crowd... more like a mob    outside Odo's office... you better    get down here...
I'm on my way...
Odo's inside?
Yessir, he went in a few minutes    ago... the crowd followed him from    the bar...
I want more security here... and I    want them armed...
Aye, sir...
It's going to be harder to control    them if the numbers keep growing...    we can secure all Turbolifts... slow    down the traffic onto the Promenade...
Good idea...
Julian, look at this...
scene: 79   INT. INFIRMARY - CLOSE ON THE MONITOR (OPTICAL)

quote: The chromatin pattern is changing...
scene: 79   INT. INFIRMARY - CLOSE ON THE MONITOR (OPTICAL)

quote: It's definitely humanoid...
scene: 79   INT. INFIRMARY - CLOSE ON THE MONITOR (OPTICAL)

quote: It's definitely humanoid... it's    definitely... my god, Dax, I think I    know what it is... run a chromosome    analysis... I think we're going to    find a gene-sequence degradation...
scene: 79   INT. INFIRMARY - CLOSE ON THE MONITOR (OPTICAL)

quote: What the hell do you people intend    to accomplish here?
We want the shape-shifter!
And what do you think you're gonna    do to him if you get him... ?
He's right.  Might be hard to get a    rope around the neck of a shape-   shifter...
Listen to me.  You will disperse    immediately... return to your    quarters... return to your ships...
He's a murderer...
We want justice...

Do you?  Justice.  Really?  Is it    justice you're after... or just some    way to express your anger?   And fear.  Look at yourselves...    in an hour, you'll regret what    you've  tried to do here.  Do not    condemn this man because he is    different than you are...
We condemn him because of the    evidence...
Then, take that evidence to a court    of law.  There will be no "justice"    served here today.
Commander Sisko... I believe there's    new evidence to consider...
The man who was murdered was not    Ibudan...
What?
Come with me...
All right... break it up now...
Move on, people... let's clear this    area...
A clone.  That's what Ibudan was    working on.  Creating a clone of    himself.
And then he killed the clone... to    frame me for his murder.
How can we be sure the victim was a    clone?
A clone has identical DNA as the    donor... but certain cloning methods    cause a characteristic gene-sequence    degradation which can be identified...
... if you know to look for it.       We've matched the victim's gene-   sequence with the fellow in the jar    here.  They're definitely both clones.
What happens to this one?
In about two days, he becomes a living,    breathing member of Bajoran society.
Let's hope he doesn't follow in his    donor's footsteps.
What about Ibudan... ?
I have an idea where to find him...
Computer, lights...
Who are you?  How did you get in    here?
Oh, I think you know...
I warn you... I'll call Ship's    security...

Do that... I have some interesting    questions to ask them... for example,    I am especially curious to know how    the name "Lamonay S." came to appear    on this ship's passenger list    yesterday...
That is my name.  And I  arranged    for transport on this vessel.   What is so strange about that?
You did not arrive on this ship...
No...
Well, just what ship, did you arrive    on, Mr. Lamonay S.?  I can't find    any record of your arrival on any    vessel that has docked here in the    last three weeks.
I assure you, you have made an    error...

I think in fact you did arrive on    this ship... and that you've spent    the last few years in a prison among    Bajoran dissidents... one of them,    I've learned, was a scientist who    was arrested by the Cardassians for    doing experimental research into tri-   phasic cloning...
Killing your own clone... is still    murder.
Computer... what time is it?
scene: 96   INT. SCHOOLROOM - CLOSE ON THE SCHOOL BELL

quote: Oh-nine-oh-seven hours... She frowns,    loops up to see... Sisko and Jake    arriving, reacting to the sight of    an empty classroom.
scene: 96   INT. SCHOOLROOM - CLOSE ON THE SCHOOL BELL

quote: I guess you were right... it isn't    going to be easy...
scene: 96   INT. SCHOOLROOM - CLOSE ON THE SCHOOL BELL

quote: Maybe it's just going to take a little    time to...
scene: 96   INT. SCHOOLROOM - CLOSE ON THE SCHOOL BELL

quote: Sit down!
scene: 96   INT. SCHOOLROOM - CLOSE ON THE SCHOOL BELL

quote: Not next to that human boy... I don't    want you to have anything to do with    him...
scene: 96   INT. SCHOOLROOM - CLOSE ON THE SCHOOL BELL

quote: We'll try it for a few weeks.
scene: 96   INT. SCHOOLROOM - CLOSE ON THE SCHOOL BELL

quote: Please come in... take any seat...    try to be on time from now on... my    name is Keiko O'Brien... and I'll be    your teacher...
